intro: Ilex chiriquensis, commonly known as the Chiriquí holly, is a species of evergreen shrub or small tree native to Central America. It belongs to the Aquifoliaceae family and is characterized by its dense, spiny leaves and small, bright red berries. The plant is typically found in humid, lowland forests and is adapted to thrive in tropical and subtropical climates. Its leaves are usually glossy and dark green, providing a striking visual contrast against its red fruit. Ilex chiriquensis plays an important ecological role by providing food and shelter for various wildlife species.
